content:
• Thursday, July 11, 2013
  • RSH

    RadioShack (NYSE:RSH) +2.3% AH after telling CNBC it has a strong balance sheet with total...

    RadioShack (NYSE:RSH) +2.3% AH after telling CNBC it has a strong balance sheet with total liquidity of $820M at the end of Q1, adding that, "like many companies, we have discussions with banks to help evaluate ways to further strengthen [the company's] balance sheet." RSH fell 7% during regular trading following reports it is seeking a banker to fix its balance sheet.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM | 3 Comments
  • VLO

    Shares of oil refiners are trading lower after Valero (NYSE:VLO) said it expects Q2 earnings to...

    Shares of oil refiners are trading lower after Valero (NYSE:VLO) said it expects Q2 earnings to come in below current estimates. VLO -4.1% AH to ~$33, and several refining peers also are lower: NTI -2.9%, ALJ -2.9%, WNR -2.6%, HFC -2.5%, TSO -2.4%, MPC -2.1%, PSX -1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • IPGP

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: IPGP +3%. NUS +3%. [[S:]] +3%. CRWN +2%. SSNC +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: IPGP +3%. NUS +3%. [[S:]] +3%. CRWN +2%. SSNC +2%.
    After-hours top losers: CERE -20%. AVEO -13%. BBDO -7%. CSIQ -6%. PBF -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • IGOI

    Microcap iGo (OTCPK:IGOI) +52.8% AH to $3.50 after Steel Excel (OTCQB:SXCL) agrees to buy 44% of...

    Microcap iGo (OTCPK:IGOI) +52.8% AH to $3.50 after Steel Excel (OTCQB:SXCL) agrees to buy 44% of the company for $3.95/share, courtesy of a cash tender offer. SXCL's offer depends on at least 30% of iGo shares being tendered. If/when the offer is successfully completed, SXCL will appoint 2 of iGo's 4 directors, and a new CEO will be named to replace current CEO Michael Heil. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (NYSE:VLO) expects Q2 EPS of $0.80-$0.90, including ~$0.05 in charges mostly...

    Valero Energy (NYSE:VLO) expects Q2 EPS of $0.80-$0.90, including ~$0.05 in charges mostly related to costs incurred in the May spinoff of CST Brands. Q2 refining segment earnings are seen declining Y/Y, partly due to significantly lower discounts for heavy sour crude oil, higher natural gas costs, and higher costs to comply with the renewable fuels standard. VLO -4.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • AVEO

    Shares of Aveo Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVEO) slide 10.63% AH as the company says it "received a...

    Shares of Aveo Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVEO) slide 10.63% AH as the company says it "received a subpoena from the SEC requesting documents and information concerning tivozanib" on July 3. (8-K)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar (NASDAQ:CSIQ) -4% AH after filing a $200M mixed shelf. If the solar module vendor...

    Canadian Solar (NASDAQ:CSIQ) -4% AH after filing a $200M mixed shelf. If the solar module vendor ends up selling shares, its giant 2013 gains will serve to lower dilution. CSIQ had $606.1M in cash/equivalents as of March 31, and $1.17B in debt. The company is expected to turn profitable in 2H. (F-3) (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • CERE

    Shares of Ceres (NASDAQ:CERE) fall 2.77% AH as commentary accompanying the FQ3 report is perhaps...

    Shares of Ceres (NASDAQ:CERE) fall 2.77% AH as commentary accompanying the FQ3 report is perhaps not as sanguine as investors had been led to believe (previous) — results also came up short on the bottom line. Although sweet sorghum yields were 50% higher Y/Y, the company says it witnessed "greater variability than expected" and notes that "many mill customers will repeat smaller scale commercial plantings before committing to broad, large-scale adoption" leading to "more modest" sweet sorghum seed sales growth than anticipated. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (NASDAQ:CPHD) reports preliminary Q2 results: GAAP net loss of $0.10/ share and non-GAAP...

    Cepheid (NASDAQ:CPHD) reports preliminary Q2 results: GAAP net loss of $0.10/ share and non-GAAP net income of $0.02/ share on revenue of ~$96M. CEO John Bishop says "record revenue and associated production volume" show the company made "good progress" on allaying investor concerns regarding Xpert test availability. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharma (PPHM): FQ4 EPS of -$0.06 in-line. Revenue of $4.25M beats by $0.68M. Shares...

    Peregrine Pharma (PPHM): FQ4 EPS of -$0.06 in-line. Revenue of $4.25M beats by $0.68M. Shares +1.97% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • FNSR

    Telecom equipment, chip, and component makers finish up strongly after Needham upgrades Finisar...

    Telecom equipment, chip, and component makers finish up strongly after Needham upgrades Finisar (FNSR +6%), Goldman upgrades Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +6.3%) and Adtran (ADTN +2.3%), and William Blair reports of positive F5 checks. Ciena (CIEN +10.1%), Riverbed (RVBD +4%), Calix (CALX +6.9%), Aruba (ARUN +5%), and JDS Uniphase (JDSU +3.6%), are among the top gainers. Needham says meetings with Finisar's chairman and CEO leave it impressed with the company's positioning and visibility.  "Finisar seems more confident in its outlook than it’s been in a number of years." Goldman responds to Adtran's strong top-line results and guidance by declaring it "uniquely positioned to benefit" from a multi-year cable/DSL broadband infrastructure upgrade cycle. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • RRC

    Range Resources' (RRC -1.6%) Q2 production rose a greater than expected 27% Y/Y on continued...

    Range Resources' (RRC -1.6%) Q2 production rose a greater than expected 27% Y/Y on continued drilling success in the Marcellus Shale, but shares are lower because it sold the oil and gas for less than expected and, for oil, prices were flat Q/Q. Natural gas, natural gas liquids and oil price realizations averaged $5.02 per mcfe, a 6% Y/Y composite increase.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • HIPPQ

    Augme Technologies (AUGT.OB -32%) craters after reporting a net loss of $0.05/share for FQ1 on...

    Augme Technologies (AUGT.OB -32%) craters after reporting a net loss of $0.05/share for FQ1 on revenue of $5.9M (+15.5% Y/Y). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • KNDI

    "Investors should strongly consider reviewing all possible findings with a critical eye to...

    "Investors should strongly consider reviewing all possible findings with a critical eye to determine the validity of the hyper-bull thesis," SA contributor Richard Pearson says, regarding shares of Kandi Technologies (KNDI -8%) which are off sharply on the session. Pearson believes that having paid off $25M in debt last month,  the company has "no near-term incentive to hype the story or promote the stock." (See also: SA contributor Sharesleuth wonders about KNDI social media campaign)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 23 Comments
  • ACAS

    Outperforming in the BDC (BDCS -0.9%) sector today is American Capital (ACAS +4.1%)  - the...

    Outperforming in the BDC (BDCS -0.9%) sector today is American Capital (ACAS +4.1%)  - the only one among the larger players not paying a dividend. Instead, an aggressive buyback program was very active during the stock's roughly 20% decline over the last 2 months, the company purchasing about 3% of the float in Q2 through June 26.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • DEST

    Destination Maternity (DEST +4%) jumps after saying revenue for FQ3 will come in at $141.9M...

    Destination Maternity (DEST +4%) jumps after saying revenue for FQ3 will come in at $141.9M (+2.2% Y/Y). DEST also guides for EPS to "be in the top half of … prior earnings guidance of $0.56-0.64." Consensus is $0.59/share on $140.65M in sales. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • CELG

    "We expect upside for shares on this derisking event," Wells Fargo says, referencing data...

    "We expect upside for shares on this derisking event," Wells Fargo says, referencing data released today by Celgene (CELG +7%) on Revlimid's performance in Phase III multiple myeloma trials. "We would remain buyers," analyst Brian Abrahams notes, adding that he "expects favorable detailed data at ASH."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +6.6%) jumps with an announcement that it’s changing how it accounts for...

    Petrobras (PBR +6.6%) jumps with an announcement that it’s changing how it accounts for currency fluctuations. The accounting move prompts Barclays to raise its EPS estimates to $0.56 for Q2 and $2.20 for FY 2013, up from $0.49 and $2.10, respectively. UBS thinks the change could help boost PBR's dividend payments, which were cut earlier this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 2 Comments
  • EPD

    Crude oil futures weaken following an unconfirmed report that the 400K bbl/day Seaway Pipeline...

    Crude oil futures weaken following an unconfirmed report that the 400K bbl/day Seaway Pipeline has been shut down. Flows from Seaway and other pipelines have been key in drawing down crude from the Midwest hub in recent weeks and sparking a jump in prices. Seaway is a 50-50 JV between operator Enterprise Products Partners (EPD +0.8%) and Enbridge (ENB +1.9%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (VLO +1.8%) plans to spend up to $700M to build a petrochemical plant at its St....

    Valero Energy (VLO +1.8%) plans to spend up to $700M to build a petrochemical plant at its St. Charles, La. refinery, the latest sign that chemicals might be the best bet for profits among refiners whose margins are shrinking due to rising oil prices. VLO's investment would be its biggest in the petrochemical business and make it one of the world's largest producers of methanol.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD +10.9%) continues rocketing higher after catching upgrades from BofA/Merrill and...

    AMD (AMD +10.9%) continues rocketing higher after catching upgrades from BofA/Merrill and Canaccord, and appears to be giving a lift to Intel (INTC +2.6%) along the way. BofA's Vivek Arya joins a long list of analysts (previous) touting AMD's Xbox One/PS4 design wins, declaring they can "transform AMD into a profitable, diversified company with a multi-year recurring revenue stream, away from its inconsistent past under Intel's shadow." Canaccord's Bobby Burleson takes a similar view, and argues AMD can outperform "PC-centric names" as embedded chip sales ramp. 15.3% of AMD's float was shorted as of June 14.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 3 Comments
  • FFIV

    Checks indicate F5's (FFIV +5.4%) sales performance improved in FQ3, as deals pushed out from...

    Checks indicate F5's (FFIV +5.4%) sales performance improved in FQ3, as deals pushed out from FQ2 managed to close, says William Blair's Jason Ader in a note lifting shares. F5 partly blamed deal push-outs on its April FQ2 warning. Ader cautions he thinks FQ3 product sales growth will be negative Y/Y, thanks to a slowing application delivery controller (ADC) market. F5 is counting on an ADC efresh and new mobile and security offerings to boost growth. Deutsche is also making positive comments on F5, stating the company is set up for "a multi-quarter product revenue ramp in next-gen security and telco." FQ3 results are due on July 24.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • MKTO

    Volatile Marketo (MKTO -10%) dives after UBS cuts shares to Sell, while maintaining a $22 IPO....

    Volatile Marketo (MKTO -10%) dives after UBS cuts shares to Sell, while maintaining a $22 IPO. The firm doesn't like a valuation of 11x forward enterprise value/sales, which puts the marketing automation software firm in the top 1/4 of UBS' cloud software comp group. Like others, UBS is concerned about the ~75% customer overlap between Marketo and Salesforce customers in light of Salesforce's purchase of Marketo rival ExactTarget, and argues Adobe's purchase of Neolane narrows the list of potential acquirers. Shares still +73% from a May 6 IPO price of $13.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • BPZ

    BPZ Resources (BPZ +5.3%) rises notably in morning trading. In a still-embargoed article, SA Pro...

    BPZ Resources (BPZ +5.3%) rises notably in morning trading. In a still-embargoed article, SA Pro contributor Caiman Valores says the company is "one of the cheapest plays on proven reserves in its industry" with an enterprise-value to 1P ratio of 22.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • ALNY

    Deutsche's Alethia Young says Alnylam's (ALNY +15.3%) ALN-TTRsc "could be a 'home run'" and...

    Deutsche's Alethia Young says Alnylam's (ALNY +15.3%) ALN-TTRsc "could be a 'home run'" and believes total peak sales for the company could be $5B if it its "key programs" are successful. (Earlier: ALNY reports data from Phase 1 ALN-TTRsc trial)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • DRGDF

    "We can get through this with no problem," Detour Gold (OTCPK:DRGDF +5.4%) CEO Gerald Panneton...

    "We can get through this with no problem," Detour Gold (OTCPK:DRGDF +5.4%) CEO Gerald Panneton says of $1,250 gold and a YTD 65% drop in the share price. The cause for optimism is the company's Detour Lake mine in Ontario, expected to be the largest gold mine in Canada; it's gradually ramping up, producing ~58K oz. of gold in Q2 and on track to reach commercial production in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • PERI

    Perion Network (PERI +1%) edges higher a day after rallying 7% on a report Web site...

    Perion Network (PERI +1%) edges higher a day after rallying 7% on a report Web site toolbar/mobile developer tool provider Conduit is in advanced talks to buy Perion for up to $200M, as part of a plan to split Conduit into two companies. Perion's market cap currently stands at $158M; its shares are up 46% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • PRXI

    Premier Exhibitions (OTC:PRXI -5.7%) slips after FQ1 results and the ensuing conference call...

    Premier Exhibitions (OTC:PRXI -5.7%) slips after FQ1 results and the ensuing conference call last night provided little positive guidance on the sale of its Titanic assets. Tight-lipped management did disclose the party who signed a letter of intent to purchase is a consortium based in Hampton Roads, VA. The consortium has made progress getting funding together (CC transcript), but PRXI management is pursuing a "parallel path" in efforts to monetize the assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • SIMO

    Silicon Motion (SIMO -1.9%) slides, and Avago (AVGO -0.1%) underperforms a bit, after getting...

    Silicon Motion (SIMO -1.9%) slides, and Avago (AVGO -0.1%) underperforms a bit, after getting removed from Deutsche's Short-term Buy List. Veeco (VECO +2.2%), meanwhile, is rallying after getting pulled from Deutsche's Short-term Sell List. Silicon Motion is 9 days removed from issuing a Q2 warning (and rallying in its aftermath), and 18 days away from issuing its full Q2 report. Veeco is still working on finishing an accounting review and getting its SEC filings current.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • VTG

    Vantage Drilling (VTG -7.4%) slides after the company announced a proposed $75M offering of...

    Vantage Drilling (VTG -7.4%) slides after the company announced a proposed $75M offering of convertible senior notes Wednesday. This morning, VTG announced the pricing of the offering (which turned out to be $85M): The notes are convertible at the company's election to ordinary shares at an initial rate of $2.39/ share. The deal has a host of stipulations and conditions that should perhaps be reviewed by shareholders. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • LZB

    The powerful rally in home builder stocks (XHB, ITB, PKB) this week is helping to push furniture...

    The powerful rally in home builder stocks (XHB, ITB, PKB) this week is helping to push furniture stocks higher on similar enthusiasm on the plight of U.S. homeowners. Outperformers: LZB +3.1%, FBN +2.7%, HVT +2.1%, ETH +1.9%, PIR +2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • NOK

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +3.3%) has been upgraded to...

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +3.3%) has been upgraded to Neutral by Goldman (previous). 2) Finisar (FNSR +4.4%) has been upgraded to Strong Buy by Needham. 3) Palo Alto Networks (PANW +5.3%) has been upgraded to Buy by UBS. 4) Jive Software (JIVE -3%) and Sourcefire (FIRE -1.4%) have been downgraded to Neutral by UBS. 5) Analog Devices (ADI +1.7%) has been upgraded to Buy by Jefferies. 6) Synchronoss (SNCR +2.8%) has been added to Wedbush's Best Ideas List. 7) Linear (LLTC +1.8%) has been upgraded to Buy by Jefferies. 8) Adtran (ADTN +4.3%) has been upgraded to Buy by Goldman following its FQ2 report and FQ3 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • GFI

    The materials sector is a big early outperformer, showing all-around strength among steelmakers...

    The materials sector is a big early outperformer, showing all-around strength among steelmakers (SLX +3.4%) and gold miners (GDX +5%) after Bernanke indicated the Fed is unlikely to scale back stimulus earlier than expected. GFI +8.4%, ABX +6%, RIO +5.9%, GG +5.2%, SLW +5.1%, BHP +5.1%, MT +5%, HL +4.6%, SLV +4.8%, HL +4.8%, CLF +4.5%, NEM +3.4%, FCX +3.2%, X +2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 3 Comments
  • APOL

    Shares of Apollo Group (APOL +8%) soar after accreditation is reaffirmed for the University of...

    Shares of Apollo Group (APOL +8%) soar after accreditation is reaffirmed for the University of Phoenix through 2022-23 although the online school is "on notice" for two years. "You could argue that if [it] was genuinely good news they would have issued a full-blown press release like BPI," Herb Greenberg quips. Across the sector: LINC +2.87%, LOPE +1%, EDMC +8.9%, STRA +1.9%, COCO +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (DRWI +11.6%) opens sharply higher after reporting FQ1 revenue of $24.5M (-13% Y/Y)...

    DragonWave (DRWI +11.6%) opens sharply higher after reporting FQ1 revenue of $24.5M (-13% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.17; the former missed by $4.8M, but the latter beat by $0.11. A big reason for the EPS beat: gross margin came in at 11.5%, up 620 bps Q/Q (though down 2040 bps Y/Y). Opex totaled $13.4M (+1% Y/Y), and DragonWave's closely-watched cash balance rose by $400K Q/Q to $23.4M. Expectations have been low for some time.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • MLCO

    Shares of Melco Crowd (MPEL +4.5%) jump after sister company Melco International Development...

    Shares of Melco Crowd (MPEL +4.5%) jump after sister company Melco International Development files a statement with Hong Kong regulators on its intention to develop two casino hotels in Russia near the China border.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • FSM

    Fortuna Silver Mines (FSM +6.2%) reports increased Q2 production from its two operating mines in...

    Fortuna Silver Mines (FSM +6.2%) reports increased Q2 production from its two operating mines in Latin America, the San Jose mine in Mexico and the Caylloma mine in Peru; silver production rose 8% Y/Y, 6% above budget, while gold production rose 11%, in-line. FSM reaffirms 2013 production guidance of 4.5M oz. of silver and 23.6K oz. of gold, or 5.9M gold equivalent oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • CHFS

    The C-Pulse Heart Assist System story is "still early with U.S. commercialization years away...

    The C-Pulse Heart Assist System story is "still early with U.S. commercialization years away [but] feasibility trial data are encouraging, European approval is secured and the market opportunity is significant," Oppenheimer's Steven Lichtman says, initiating shares of Sunshine Heart (SSH +5.2%) at Outperform with an $11 price target. The new coverage was reported here yesterday and has the shares moving sharply higher in early trading. "The next major catalysts will be reimbursement notifications in Europe early in '14," Lichtman notes.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • BCRX

    BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX +6.13%) says the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development...

    BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX +6.13%) says the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority has released funding which will allow the company to complete an NDA for peramivir. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM
  • GTXI

    More on Wedbush's GTx (NASDAQ:GTXI) defense which is likely behind the stock's 9.2% premarket...

    More on Wedbush's GTx (NASDAQ:GTXI) defense which is likely behind the stock's 9.2% premarket rally: "It bears repeating that … comparisons across groups of kilogram weight changes or watt power measurements" are not endpoints in the Phase III study, but "response rate for physical function" is, and the Lancet publication shows a 61% response rate vs. 39% placebo rate. Analyst David Nierengarten also says the mean/ median distinction in "the journalist's" article "ignores the design of the Phase III studies." Wedbush thinks enobosarm will meet its co-primary endpoints. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • HES

    Hess (NYSE:HES) +2.2% premarket after J.P. Morgan upgrades shares to Overweight from Neutral...

    Hess (NYSE:HES) +2.2% premarket after J.P. Morgan upgrades shares to Overweight from Neutral with an $84 price target, up from $73, saying the current asset divestiture program will unlock up to $4B in value not reflected in its prior valuations. In just the past two weeks, Hess revealed plans to sell Asian assets, its oil terminal network and its U.S. gas station chain.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM

  • Market preview: It's risk on after Ben Bernanke caught markets by surprise with dovish comments...

    Market preview: It's risk on after Ben Bernanke caught markets by surprise with dovish comments about his monetary policy. U.S. stock futures, EU shares and Treasury prices are higher, as are gold, silver and copper, although oil has been left out of the fun following a bearish IEA report. Bernanke "will be stimulating less, but that’s not the same as tightening," says strategist Henrik Drusebjerg. The S&P Mini is +0.9%. Later: Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • AMBI

    Ambit Biosciences (NASDAQ:AMBI) is up 19.28% premarket (200 shares traded). The stock rallied 5%...

    Ambit Biosciences (NASDAQ:AMBI) is up 19.28% premarket (200 shares traded). The stock rallied 5% Wednesday after the company's presentation at the JMP Healthcare Conference (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • BPI

    Premarket gainers: BPI +25%. RMTI +25%. BCRX +16%. ALNY +13%. APOL +8%. NG +8%. GTXI +8%. AXU...

    Premarket gainers: BPI +25%. RMTI +25%. BCRX +16%. ALNY +13%. APOL +8%. NG +8%. GTXI +8%. AXU +8%. GOLD +7%. GFI +7%.
    Losers: LEDS -24%. VTG -10%. EGAS -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • GFI

    Gold Fields (NYSE:GFI) expects its Q2 attributable production to total 451K gold equivalent oz.,...

    Gold Fields (NYSE:GFI) expects its Q2 attributable production to total 451K gold equivalent oz., with cash costs and notional cash expenditure of ~$860/oz. and $1,250/oz. respectively, and says it remains on track to achieve FY 2013 production guidance of 1.825M-1.9M oz. GFI +7.2% premarket, as the mining sector enjoys a big boost from Bernanke's dovish comments yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • BPI

    Barrington upgrades Bridgepoint Education (NYSE:BPI) to Outperform from Market Perform after the...

    Barrington upgrades Bridgepoint Education (NYSE:BPI) to Outperform from Market Perform after the company's AH announcement Wednesday regarding accreditation for Ashford, cost savings initiatives, and Q2 financial results. Unfortunately for investors, the upgrade appears to have come too late to capitalize on a 23% move in the shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • ORMP

    Oramed Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ORMP) slides 3.26% premarket after announcing a 657,144 share...

    Oramed Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ORMP) slides 3.26% premarket after announcing a 657,144 share direct offering ($7/share) after the close Wednesday. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 1 Comment

  • Gold's ahead 3% and Silver 5% following Bernanke's dovish remarks last night. GLD +2.9%, SLV...

    Gold's ahead 3% and Silver 5% following Bernanke's dovish remarks last night. GLD +2.9%, SLV +5.3% premarket. The devastated miners look to catch a big opening bounce as well, GDX +5.4%. Copper (JJC) +3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM | 9 Comments

  • Regional shares are higher in Southeast Asia following a 50 basis point rate hike by Bank...

    Regional shares are higher in Southeast Asia following a 50 basis point rate hike by Bank Indonesia. As expected, Malaysia's central bank keeps rates unchanged as strong domestic demand and jitters regarding rising household debt help offset concerns that slowing external demand will weigh too heavily on slipping economic growth — Malaysian stocks (EWM) rise 0.7%. Meanwhile, Thai shares (THD) jump 4.22% and the Straits Times (EWS, EWSS) climbs 1.91%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • AMD

    Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) +6.8% premarket after a pair of upgrades. BAML offers a...

    Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) +6.8% premarket after a pair of upgrades. BAML offers a 2-notch boost to Buy from Sell, and Canaccord ups to a Buy with $5 price target (from $3).

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM | 4 Comments
  • IOC

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) appoints Michael Hession as its new CEO, effective immediately. Hession is a...

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) appoints Michael Hession as its new CEO, effective immediately. Hession is a 25-year veteran of international exploration and operation, including 12 years at Woodside Energy, where most recently he was a senior VP at Browse LNG Development. IOC +2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM | 1 Comment

  • Indonesia's central bank is not interested in a wait-and-see approach regarding the possibility...

    Indonesia's central bank is not interested in a wait-and-see approach regarding the possibility that a fuel tax hike could result in "second-round" core price inflation. Bank Indonesia raised rates by a half-percentage point Thursday, bucking the regional "stand pat" trend (Thailand, BOJ, South Korea, Malaysia), even as weaker economic growth likely lies ahead for the country — local stocks (IDX, EIDO) rise 2.8% on the session.

  • RMTI

    Rockwell Medical's (NASDAQ:RMTI) SFP iron-deficiency drug for chronic kidney disease met the...

    Rockwell Medical's (NASDAQ:RMTI) SFP iron-deficiency drug for chronic kidney disease met the main goal of a Phase III trial by improving hemoglobin levels in adult patients. The treatment also met the secondary goals of the study, which was the first of two late-stage trials. SFP proved to be safe as well, consistently maintaining hemoglobin levels without increasing iron stores. Shares slumped 13.6% in AH trading yesterday prior to the release of the results, but there could be a dramatic turnaround today. (PR)
